intro: Omphalocarpum pedicellatum, commonly known as the clustered burr grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its spiny, clustered fruits that contain seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by animals. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. The species is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
